location.physicalLocation: British Library: India Office Records and Private Papers

titleInfo.title: Letter from Lieutenant William Bruce, Resident, Bushire, to Francis Warden, Chief Secretary to the Government, Bombay

mods.abstract: Letter relates to the wreck of the Ahmed Shahand the subsequent ill conduct of the Shaik [Shaikh Abdullah bin Ahmad] of Charrack [Bandar-e ChƒÅrak]. William Bruce reports that Stephen Watson Henshaw, accompanied by the ship's commander, Captain [S] Herriman, has proceeded to Charrack, in order to demand the property that may be saved. Bruce also informs Warden of the great friendship shown towards the British Government by Shaik Kalfan [Shaikh Khalfan], Governor of Assaloo [Bandar-e `Asaluyeh]. Bruce states that the packet entrusted to the Ahmed Shahwill now be forwarded by the first vessel that leaves Bushire. Includes Bruce's thoughts on which items from the ship's cargo are likely to be retrievable.
